definition: to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick

sentences.english: The short-haired bumblebee is a very fussy eater, " she said.
See? Picky eaters like food, too.
sentences.chinese: 看吧，挑食的人也喜欢食物。

sentences.english: With a restricted range of foods, if children turn their nose up at one particular foodyouy, you could be stuck for choice.
sentences.chinese: 由于食物严格分类，如果孩子们挑食，你便陷于抉择。

sentences.english: You won't grow up to be big and strong, if you're so picky.
sentences.chinese: 如果你那么挑食就不会长的又高又壮。

sentences.english: The fact that children from poor families rarely have the antifeedant and choosy food.
sentences.chinese: 事实也说明，贫困家庭的孩子很少有拒食和挑食的。

sentences.english: Many toddlers are notoriously choosy about their foods and reticent to try new things.
sentences.chinese: 许多咿呀学步的孩子非常挑食，而且不愿尝试新事物。

sentences.english: I can watch TV and I am not picky any more.
sentences.chinese: 我能看电视了，而且我再也不挑食了。

sentences.english: Is Picky Eating an Early Sign of Autism?
sentences.chinese: 儿童挑食是自闭症的前兆吗？

sentences.english: Picky 99ers? It sounds like you haven't lost your job.
sentences.chinese: 挑食的99党人？听起来你还没丢失工作。

definition: partial to (some kinds of food, usu. unhealthy)/having likes and dislikes/partial eclipse
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
